title: Facebook share link without JavaScript - Stack Overflow
text: It is possible to include JavaScript in your code and still support non-JavaScript users. If a user clicks any of the following links without JavaScript enabled, it will simply open a new tab: Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Googleplus Because they contain the share-popup class, we can easily reference these in jQuery, and change the window size to suit the domain we are sharing from: $(".share-popup").click(function(){ var window_size = "width=585,height=511"; var url = this.href; var domain = url.split("/")[2]; switch(domain) { case "www.facebook.com": window_size = "width=585,height=368"; break; case "www.twitter.com": window_size = "width=585,height=261"; break; case "plus.google.com": window_size = "width=517,height=511"; break; } window.open(url, '', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,' + window_size); return false; }); No more ugly inline JavaScript, or countless window sizing alterations. And it still supports non-JavaScript users.
